What is a Sri Lanka Virtual Phone Number?

Sri Lanka virtual number is a VoIP number that is not attached to a specific phone line or location. It does not require set-up offices to make a call; you only need a smart device with good internet connectivity.

Every internet-connected device allows you to communicate with anyone, anytime, anywhere, unlike physical phone numbers.

Budget-friendly: Since virtual phone numbers do not require setting up an office with hardware devices, they are usually cheaper than traditional phone numbers for international locations.

What types of Sri Lanka virtual phone numbers can you get?

The following are the four types of virtual phone numbers in Sri Lanka.

1. Local phone number

Local numbers are specific to a particular region or city in Sri Lanka. It consists of 10 digits that splits into four parts. If you want to dial a local phone in Sri Lanka, you should include a country code, area code, operator code, and 6 exchange numbers.

Format: [Country code] – [area code] – [operator code] – [line number]

Example:+94 052 2 589455

2. Mobile number

Mobile numbers in Sri Lanka are specific to network providers and consist of 10-digit numbers. All the mobile operators in Sri Lanka start with 07. The mobile prefix has 3 digits starting with the country code and the remaining numbers.

Format: [country code]- [mobile prefix]-[line number]

Example: +94 071 5648795

3. Toll-Free number

Toll-free business phone numbers in Sri Lanka are 8 or 9-digit numbers that do not require a charge to call. The numbers usually start with 120, followed by the remaining numbers

Format: [country code]-[toll-free prefix]-[line number]

Example: +94 (120) 784554

4. Vanity number

Vanity numbers are similar to Toll-free numbers that do not require charges to make a call. Vanity number includes a brand name or phrases so that the customers will remember. The letters in phone numbers are put for marketing purposes.

Example: +94 120 CONVERSE

Can I use the Sri Lanka virtual phone number to receive SMS and OTP verification?

You can receive SMS and OTP using Sri Lanka’s virtual number in the SMS inbox of the service provider app. You can request an OTP with the virtual number, and the application will provide it through text messages.

What documents are required to get a Sri Lanka virtual phone number?

Virtual phone number providers will require you to submit verification of identity and proof of address for verification. The types of documents needed can change depending on the usage. A passport, Citizenship, account details, and driving license are some of the examples of documents you’ll require.

What are the limitations of Sri Lanka virtual phone numbers?

Some limitations in Sri Lanka virtual phone numbers are:

Always needs an internet connection; without the internet, you can not make or receive calls.

Security issues as your number can be stolen and used for identity theft and scam calls.

You’ll have to pay extra money to add features.

Where can I use the Sri Lanka Virtual phone number?

You can use the Sri Lanka virtual phone number anywhere and in any part of the world. All you need is a smart device and a good internet connection and set up as many users as you want.
